qas.question: What does classical music convey in movies and television?
What piece by Vivaldi is used as a cliche to convey opulence?
What piece by Mozart is used as a cliche to convey refinement?
Who wrote Night on Bald Mountain?

context: Similarly, movies and television often revert to standard, clichéd snatches of classical music to convey <a0_0>refinement or opulence<a0_0/>: some of the most-often heard pieces in this category include Bach´s Cello Suite No. 1, Mozart's <a2_0>Eine kleine Nachtmusik<a2_0/>, Vivaldi's <a1_0>Four Seasons<a1_0/>, <a4_0>Mussorgsky<a4_0/>'s Night on Bald Mountain (as orchestrated by Rimsky-Korsakov), and <a3_0>Rossini<a3_0/>'s William Tell Overture.
